title: One Turkish soldier killed, five wounded in northeast Syria: ministry
text:
FILE PHOTO: Turkey-backed Syrian rebel fighters gather near the border town of Tal Abyad, Syria October 24, 2019. REUTERS/Khalil Ashawi

ISTANBUL (Reuters) - One Turkish military personnel was killed and five were wounded in Syria’s Ras Al-Ayn region after a rocket and mortar attack by Kurdish YPG militia, Turkey’s Defence Ministry said on Sunday.

The military was conducting reconnaissance work and responded in kind to the attack, the ministry said in a statement.

Related Coverage Clashes between Turkish forces and Syrian army in north Syria: SANA
description: One Turkish military personnel was killed and five were wounded in Syria's Ras Al-Ayn region after a rocket and mortar attack by Kurdish YPG militia, Turkey's Defence Ministry said on Sunday.
